markdown.headingText: Cresko Lab Website - Formatting Updates Complete
markdown.markdown:
## Summary of Changes

I've successfully updated your Cresko Laboratory website with all the requested formatting changes. Here's what was modified:

### 1. ✅ Projects Page Layout (1/3 - 2/3 split)
- **Changed**: Title now takes up 1/3 of the width (left column)
- **Changed**: Funding details, years, and descriptions now take up 2/3 of the width (right column)
- The layout is now reversed from before, with more space for project details
- Text in the details column is now left-aligned for better readability

### 2. ✅ Team Page - Uniform Member Profiles
- **Added**: All team members now have the same format as the PI
- **Format**: Profile picture on the left (120x120 circular images)
- **Format**: Name, position, and description on the right
- **Added**: Placeholder profile images for all team members
- **Note**: Replace the placeholder images in `/files/profiles/` with actual photos

### 3. ✅ Publications Page - Three Column Layout
- **Added**: New leftmost column for journal icons (60px wide)
- **Changed**: Paper title takes up approximately 1/3 of remaining width
- **Changed**: Citation details take up approximately 2/3 of remaining width
- **Added**: Font Awesome icons for different journal types:
  - Bacteria icon for mBio
  - Fish icon for Journal of Fish Biology
  - Database icon for GigaByte
  - DNA icon for Frontiers in Genetics
  - Flask icon for PNAS
  - Microscope icon for Genetics
- **Note**: You can customize these icons based on actual journal logos

### 4. ✅ Talks Page - Lorem Ipsum Examples
- **Replaced**: All specific talk entries with Lorem Ipsum placeholder text
- **Structure preserved**: Maintains the two-column layout
- **Sections included**:
  - 2024 talks (2 examples)
  - 2023 talks (2 examples)
  - 2022 talks (1 example)
  - Upcoming talks section
  - Media appearances section
- **Ready for**: You to replace with actual talk information

### 5. ✅ Blog Page - Larger Date Display
- **Added**: CSS styling to increase the date font size to 1.1rem
- **Added**: Made dates bold (font-weight: 500)
- **Added**: Applied purple accent color (#663399) to dates
- Dates are now more prominent and easier to scan

## Technical Details

### CSS Classes Added/Modified:
- `.team-member` - New flex layout for team profiles
- `.team-member-image` - Circular profile images
- `.team-member-text` - Member details and bio
- `.team-member-links` - Contact links styling
- `.publication-icon` - New column for journal icons
- `.listing-date` - Enhanced blog post date styling
- Updated grid layouts for projects (1fr 2fr) and publications (60px 1fr 2fr)

### Responsive Design:
- All layouts automatically collapse to single column on mobile devices (<768px)
- Team member profiles stack vertically on mobile
- Publication icons hidden on mobile to save space
- Projects and talks maintain readability on all screen sizes

## Files Modified:
1. `/styles.css` - All CSS updates
2. `/publications.qmd` - Added journal icon column
3. `/people.qmd` - Reformatted all team members
4. `/talks.qmd` - Replaced with Lorem Ipsum examples
5. Created `/files/profiles/placeholder-male.jpg` and `placeholder-female.jpg`

## Next Steps:
1. **Add Real Profile Photos**: Replace placeholder images in `/files/profiles/`
2. **Update Talk Information**: Replace Lorem Ipsum text in talks.qmd with actual presentations
3. **Customize Journal Icons**: Consider using actual journal logos or more specific icons
4. **Review and Adjust**: Test the site and make any fine-tuning adjustments

## Building the Site:
To see your changes, you'll need to:
1. Install Quarto if not already installed (https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)
2. Run `quarto render` in the project directory
3. Or use the provided `build.sh` script for an interactive menu

The website now has a more professional, consistent layout inspired by Silvia Canelón's academic site style, with better use of screen space and improved visual hierarchy across all pages.
